channel.title: Children's area
channel.description:
IIRC, the staff's families also live in the Black Mesa Complex. If this is correct, if there could possibly be a child center that you perhaps pass by on the train in during Inbound, and have this tune barely audible on the train itself when you pass by the child center: [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3N2k5gEgE2E[/url]
While this would be meant as a joke for the player, this a serious suggestion and not a joke thread. I always love discovering hidden bits of humor in games and that song barely audible--maybe even only in a specific spot on the train--would be a perfect example of that. :smiley:

item.title: Children's area
item.dc:creator: geekofalltrades
item.description:
Elephant454:

WRONG SIR! Look in his locker and in the top corner you will see a photo of his child…

Look up. Gordon has no child; the picture was of one of the HL developer’s children, and was placed there as an easter egg.

item.title: Children's area
item.dc:creator: Jethrosoup
item.description:
If he had a child and was any sort of good parent, HL and HL2 would be about his quest for his offspring.

Though, I guess since he never speaks there’s no way to know that isn’t what it’s ultimately about… :brow:

[COLOR=‘Black’]Nah, you’re a dumbass.

Read full topic

item.title: Children's area
item.dc:creator: Elephant454
item.description:
RestlessMind:

Yeah, Gordon Freeman was housed in the dormitories he was housed in, because he was single.

So the kiddies are at the surface, probably. Means they either got out OK, or the HECU had a really really crappy job up there.

WRONG SIR! Look in his locker and in the top corner you will see a photo of his child…

Read full topic

Anyway, if there there is a children’s area, it needs to have a secret hidden weapon like a glock in a desk.

item.title: Children's area
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
Dias:

I know that this is a joke & all, but what exactly is it about Call of Duty that makes everyone around here hate it with such a passion? I’ve only played a little bit of it, but most of the complaints I hear about are the jam-on-the-screen effect, ironsights & other fairly trivial fads that don’t really hurt the gameplay that much. Turning Half-Life into a third-person rail-shooter sounds a dozen times worse than anything I could see COD doing to it.

In this case, I was making a jab towards CoD’s heavy linearity, lack of ways to interact with the environment, monotonous firefights, and the objectives that tell you exactly what to do. Seriously, it tells you to pull this valve to solve a puzzle or walk forward, to the point that there’s really nothing to do but walk forward, shoot, and occasionally press the use key, which is no fun with things like iron sights obstructing gameplay. There are also scenes that kill you or teleport you if you don’t do exactly what the devs expect/want you to, and even a suprising number of occurrences of invincible guys with rocket launchers; in Modern Warfare, I had to spend an entire chapter rescuing the crew of a helicopter because the guy who shot it down was immune to my perfectly aimed gatling gun fire for the entire scene.

As a PC Gamer review put, Call of Duty wants to be a movie, but it’s a game.

Read full topic
